newsitem.title: UK: SOCCER-LIVERPOOL SAY SORRY TO SUGAR.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-LIVERPOOL SAY SORRY TO SUGAR.

text.p: Liverpool officials have formally apologised to Tottenham chairman Alan Sugar for a newspaper article in which his running of the club was attacked by defender Neil Ruddock.

The move could save the Liverpool centre-back from facing a charge of bringing the game into disrepute, even though the English Football Association (F.A.) said on Wednesday they were considering what to do about an official complaint to them by Sugar.
Club spokesman Ian Cotton said: "Liverpool have no prior knowledge of any newspaper article and the club has apologised to Mr Sugar."
In the article, Ruddock, a 2.5 million pounds sterling ($4.2 million) buy from Tottenham in July 1993, accused Sugar of failing "to run Spurs as a football club".
